description:
When will self-driving cars become the norm? How soon until an AI passes the Turing Test, and how soon afterwards will we all be out of a job? Which organization will be the first to unleash uncontrolled all-consuming nanomachines upon the world? That is what we'll discuss this month (until the conversation goes wildly off-topic, as it usually does). If you've read anything interesting recently about new technologies and future trends, please share. Fermi estimates and predictionbook.com will be involved.

The meeting will be in English to facilitate both French and Dutch speaking members.
name: This month's topic: Futurology!

description:
On one train track: three transhuman babies. On the other train track, a utility monster who regularly paints masterpieces. Next to you on the bridge, a very fat blue-spotted giraffe, last of its kind. What's a moral agent to do? And what if the giraffe... was your mother? All these questions and more won't be answered in this month's meetup.

We may have to taboo a lot of words in the process, so recommended reading: http://lesswrong.com/lw/nu/taboo_your_words/

This meetup marks the two-years anniversary of the LW Brussels meetup group. There will be cake. It is all right to eat the cake, as that cake would've grown up to become Hitler. (It is also all right to *bring* cake.)


LW link: http://lesswrong.com/r/discussion/lw/ji7/meetup_brussels_morality_also_cake/
name: Morality - also cake

description:
This month we're stealing an idea from the Atlanta group: using Wits & Wagers for confidence calibration (and a little Fermi estimation, which I keep saying we'll do and we never end up doing). It's like a trivia game, except you don't need to know anything to win! (errata: you do need to know that you don't know anything. else.) We may spice it up with some paranoid debating.

I also have a game related to the Memory Palace, and another one related to the Ultimatum Game. But we may not have time to do everything.

If someone can get their hands on an English copy of Wits & Wagers (or Gambit 7), please tell me.


The Brussels meetup group communicates through a Google Group. This is just a mirror announcement. Also, I just found out that meetup.com allows automatic "second Saturday of the month" meetups, so no more late announcements here!
name: Calibration and other games

description:
(Because of a scheduling conflict with the Berlin community meetup, April's meetup will not be on the second Saturday of the month. It's one week later.)

No serious theme for this month. We'll probably chat about Berlin, play boardgames that aren't rationalist training, and just talk about anything we want.


The Brussels meetup group communicates through a Google Group. This is just a mirror.

LW announcement
name: Brussels - all fun and games

description:
According to a 2010 unscientific internet survey, over 5% of LessWrong users have Asperger syndrome, which is maybe 25 times more than the general population.

I know, I know. On a website that's all about hyper-rationality and breaking down social interactions into their game theory origin in order to design an AI that can do them better? Shocking.

In this month's meetup (what little of it we'll spend being on-topic), we will discuss what a boring world it would be if we were all the same, and how to rephrase this saying to appeal to people who think boring is good.

______


We will meet at 1 pm at "La Fleur en papier doré", close to the Brussels Central station. Depending on the weather, we may also spend some time outside. The meeting will be in English to facilitate both French and Dutch speaking members.

If you are coming for the first time, please consider filling out this one minute form to share your contact information.

The Brussels meetup group communicates through a Google Group.
name: LW monthly meetup: Neuroatypicality

description:
This month's meetup doesn't have a big serious theme (in parts because I'm late on my organizer duties again...). Just the usual: social chat, discussing science, psychology or philosophy, and possibly some boardgaming.

description:
Overly late update : this month, Axel, one of our regulars, wanted to do a meetup in his home town of Hasselt this month to find out if there were any local lesswrong fans. http://lesswrong.com/meetups/14v

I realize that the lateness of this update reflects poorly on my skills as meetup organizer, and I apologise. ( Frankly, those skills are nonexistent. I have the job because nobody else wants it.)

Next month will be in Brussels as usual. 

____

If you are coming for the first time, please consider filling out this one minute form to share your contact information.

The Brussels meetup group communicates through a Google Group.
how_to_find_us: We'll be meeting at 1pm at the Stationsbuffet cafe which is in the same building as the train station itself, you can't miss it.
name: LW monthly meetup (topic TBD)

description:
Hi all,

As on every second Saturday of the month, it's meetup time. It's approximately Halloween (eight days are nothing over the lifetime of a species!) so this month we'll be talking about rational horror.

Information-theoretic death. Mutually assured destruction. Von Neumann probes with deadly payloads. Super-intelligences with non-human values. Super-intelligences with slightly non-human values. Meta jokes about the current status of LessWrong Brussels. Moloch the incomprehensible prison. The heat death of the universe. We welcome relevant scientific news, science-fiction recommendations, transhumanist musings, and chilling heavenward curses.


______


We will meet at 1 pm at "La Fleur en papier doré", close to the Brussels Central station. Depending on the weather, we may also spend some time outside. The meeting will be in English to facilitate both French and Dutch speaking members.

If you are coming for the first time, please consider filling out this one minute form to share your contact information.

The Brussels meetup group communicates through a Google Group. This meetup page does not reflect actual meetup attendance (which isn't that much higher, mind you).
name: LW monthly meetup: Hell and existential risks
